title: How to Make Caramel Filled Apple Slices

steps.headline: Cut apples in half.
steps.description: Make sure apples are washed and clean before you slice. Cut right down the middle leaving skin and core in place.

steps.headline: Scoop and remove apple core.
steps.description: Using the melon ball scoop encircle and lift out core. Hollow out apple without removing too much of the flesh. Don’t penetrate through the skin and leave most of the apple flesh in tact.

steps.headline: Pour caramel sauce into hollowed apples.
steps.description: Fill approximately ¾ of the way with sauce.

steps.headline: Place caramel filled apples on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper.
steps.description: Place baking sheet in the refrigerator and chill apples for a few hours or until caramel sets.

steps.headline: Cut apples into slices.
steps.description: You should see caramel on both sides of the apple.

text: Cut apples in half. Make sure apples are washed and clean before you slice. Cut right down the middle leaving skin and core in place. Scoop and remove apple core. Using the melon ball scoop encircle and lift out core. Hollow out apple without removing too much of the flesh. Don’t penetrate through the skin and leave most of the apple flesh in tact. Pour caramel sauce into hollowed apples. Fill approximately ¾ of the way with sauce. Place caramel filled apples on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper. Place baking sheet in the refrigerator and chill apples for a few hours or until caramel sets. Cut apples into slices. You should see caramel on both sides of the apple.
